title: 9 things to know about Red Sox’ situation entering MLB offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Craig Breslow is entering his third offseason as Red Sox chief baseball officer amidst roster and payroll decisions.
The Red Sox must decide on free agents including Dustin May and Rob Refsnyder, with potential opt-outs from Alex Bregman and Trevor Story.
Boston's offseason needs include starting pitchers and infielders, with possible targets like Kyle Schwarber, Bo Bichette, and Dylan Cease.

title: CBS’s Jason McCourty has seen a lot of the Patriots this season, and even he didn’t see this level of success coming
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Jason McCourty will call his third Patriots game of the regular season against the Falcons on Sunday.
The Patriots have a surprising 6-2 record with quarterback Drake Maye emerging as a potential MVP candidate.
McCourty, now an NFL analyst for CBS and ESPN, is impressed by Maye's rapid improvement and the team's culture.

title: Patriots reportedly targeting Dolphins pass rusher ahead of trade deadline
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots are reportedly targeting Dolphins edge rusher Jaelan Phillips ahead of Tuesday's NFL trade deadline.
Phillips, 26, has logged 3 sacks in the last month and is in the final year of his rookie contract.
The Dolphins, currently 2-7, may trade Phillips for at least a third-round pick following management changes.

title: Marco Sturm: Bruins’ Mason Lohrei should be angry after getting scratched again
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Mason Lohrei is benched for the third consecutive game as Bruins face the Hurricanes.
Coach Marco Sturm encourages Lohrei to use his time off the ice to learn and improve.
With Lohrei benched, the Bruins have improved defensively with Nikita Zadorov alongside Charlie McAvoy.

title: 5 things to know about Falcons before Sunday’s game vs. Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Falcons enter Sunday's game against the Patriots with a 3-4 record and hope to ignite a playoff push.
Falcons' Bijan Robinson leads the NFL in scrimmage yards per game and poses a dual-threat challenge for defenses.
Falcons' defense ranks second in yards allowed, featuring a standout secondary that includes cornerback A.J. Terrell.

title: Pair of former Red Sox save Dodgers to force Game 7 of World Series
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mookie Betts and Kiké Hernandez led the Dodgers to a 3-1 victory over the Blue Jays in Game 6.
Betts hit a two-run single in the third inning, breaking his World Series slump and giving the Dodgers a 3-0 lead.
Hernandez made a critical play in left field, throwing out a Blue Jays runner to seal the win and force Game 7.

title: Frights and delights: A look at some of Boston’s stand-out Halloween costumes
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: MBTA staff celebrated Halloween by handing out candy on the T, dressed as Wizard of Oz characters, a pirate, and more.
Boston Police participated in East Boston's Halloween events, with sightings of a SpongeBob costume and a future cadet.
Boston Medical Center's NICU showcased costumed babies as superheroes and mermaids, with outfits made by nurses or donated.

title: A winning Powerball ticket remains unclaimed in Mass. — and expires next month
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: A $50,000 Powerball ticket purchased in Marlborough, Mass., remains unclaimed and expires on November 20, 2025.
The winning ticket was bought at New Capital Farms in Marlborough for the November 20, 2024, drawing.
Unclaimed prize money will be distributed to Massachusetts' 351 cities and towns if not claimed by the deadline.

title: W. Va. couple had their dream Halloween wedding in Salem
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Thaddeus and Danielle Martin married in Salem on Halloween at Willows Park in a themed wedding.
The couple traveled from West Virginia, spending a week in Salem waiting for their marriage license.
Justice of the Peace Penny Richards officiated the ceremony, which was captured by Jay Willet of WBZ.

title: Jaylen Brown continues to shine as Celtics hold off furious 76ers run, win third straight: 9 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Jaylen Brown led the Celtics with 32 points in a 109-108 win over the 76ers, marking their third straight victory.
Anfernee Simons showed aggressive play but struggled in execution, while Derrick White and Payton Pritchard continue to face shooting difficulties.
The Celtics matched the 76ers with 56 rebounds each, grabbing more offensive boards with contributions from González, Minott, and Hauser.
